description:
Bio Base Europe Pilot Plant was established in 2008 and currently has more than 165 employees.
 We work in a unique, open innovation pilot and demonstration facility for process development, scaling up and (trial) production of bio-based products and processes, from laboratory to multi-ton scale.
 
 We combine a wide and flexible range of modular unit operations with a team of highly qualified and experienced bio-process engineers and technicians to translate laboratory-scale bio-based processes into cost-effective industrial processes. Bio Base Europe Pilot Plant wants to be the workplace where all employees can grow and use their full potential. We offer a pleasant atmosphere, value and reward initiative, hard work and commitment.
 
 ********
 
 TOPIC 4 - Hybrid process development for upcycling mixed plastic waste into high-value dicarboxylic acids
 Available from July 2025
 
 Project description:
 The HYBRID project aims to address two major challenges: the incineration of difficult-to-recycle plastic waste, leading to CO2 emissions, and the fossil-based production of virgin plastics from long-chain dicarboxylic acid (DCA) monomers. By integrating pyrolysis, biological funnelling, fermentation, and advanced product recovery techniques, the project seeks to convert mixed plastic waste into high-value DCAs, critical for producing textile polymers, polyesters, lubricants, and plasticizers.
 This internship, part of the HYBRID project, focuses on upcycling plastic waste into DCAs using a yeast-based fermentation platform. Key tasks include:
 Fermentation Process Development: Investigate and optimize the fermentation behaviour of engineered strains with varying waste-derived feedstocks.
 Biphasic Fermentation: Develop an advanced, multi-phase fermentation process with in situ product recovery and resource recycling.
 Process Integration and Scale-Up: Transfer and evaluate the developed process at bioreactor scale and boost the process performance by in-depth optimisation. Collaborate with engineers to scale up the optimized process.
 This internship at Bio Base Europe Pilot Plant (BBEPP) offers hands-on experience in fermentation and downstream purification technologies and supports the transition to a circular bio economy. All experimental work will be performed in the industrial environment of BBEPP using state-of-the-art equipment, in cooperation with a team of experienced professionals. Your work will contribute to the Flemish-funded HYBRID project, crucial for further development and industrial scale-up.
other_requirements: If trainee does not have EEA or Swiss nationality, stay is limited to 90 days.

field2: Bioengineering/Biomedical Engineering, Bioinformatics, Biomedical Sciences, Biotechnology
field: Bioengineering/Biomedical Engineering, Bioinformatics, Biomedical Sciences, Biotechnology
description:
The intern will join the Cancer Cachexia Omics Laboratory at São Paulo State University (UNESP) to study tumor–host interactions and tissue wasting (muscle/adipose) using advanced omics and AI tools. Depending on background and interests, the project will prioritize one or more tracks below (all projects include good practices in reproducible research, documentation, and weekly mentoring meetings):
 
 A) Single-cell transcriptomics
 
 Process and analyze scRNA-seq datasets (QC, normalization with SCTransform, batch correction with Harmony).
 
 Clustering/annotation (marker discovery), differential expression, pathway enrichment.
 
 Doublet detection (e.g., DoubletFinder) and lineage/trajectory exploration when applicable.
 
 Deliverables: a fully documented analysis notebook (R/Python), figures, and a short report of biological insights on tumor microenvironment and cachexia-related cell states.
 
 B) Spatial transcriptomics
 
 Analysis of spatial gene expression (e.g., Seurat spatial, Squidpy) to map cell–cell communication in tissues affected by cancer cachexia.
 
 Integration of histology features and spatial neighborhoods; optional deconvolution.
 
 Deliverables: spatial maps, interaction/ligand–receptor summaries, and a concise written interpretation.
 
 C) Bioinformatics & Systems Biology (multi-omics integration)
 
 Integrate bulk RNA-seq, single-cell, spatial, and/or proteomics; perform pathway/network analyses (e.g., OmniPath ligand–receptor, secretome/immune crosstalk).
 
 Build reproducible pipelines with version control; prepare publication-quality figures.
 
 Deliverables: standardized workflow, README, and result summary.
 
 D) Molecular & Cellular Cancer Biology (theoretical/analysis-driven)
 
 Literature-guided framing of mechanisms of cancer cachexia, tumor biology, and tissue remodeling (muscle/adipose).
 
 Curate gene sets/biomarkers; connect computational results with biological hypotheses and potential validation strategies.
 
 Deliverables: mini-review style memo linking computational findings to mechanisms.
 
 E) Machine Learning & AI applied to Omics
 
 Apply classical ML and/or AI models to identify biomarkers and molecular signatures of cachexia (feature selection, cross-validation, model interpretation).
 
 Emphasis on transparent, reproducible modeling and biological interpretability.
 
 Deliverables: ML pipeline (code + report) and candidate biomarkers/signatures.
 
 All tracks include weekly supervision, optional participation in lab meetings/journal clubs, and the opportunity to contribute to manuscripts, posters, or preprints when results warrant.
other_requirements:
- For systems biology: experience integrating bulk RNA-seq, single-cell, spatial, proteomics; pathway and network analysis (e.g., OmniPath, ligand–receptor).
 
 - Domain knowledge (nice-to-have): cancer biology, tumor microenvironment, cachexia, muscle/adipose tissue remodeling.
 
 - Good scientific communication in English; collaborative mindset.
requiredknowledgeandexperiences:
Not mandatory, but preferred:
 
 - Basic proficiency in R and/or Python; Linux/command line; Git/GitHub.
 
 - Intro to data wrangling and visualization.
 
 - For single-cell: prior exposure to Seurat/Scanpy, SCTransform, Harmony, QC concepts; familiarity with cell type annotation.
 
 - For spatial: interest/experience with Squidpy, Seurat (spatial) or similar; image–omics integration is a plus.

description:
1. Support for Sample Collection and Data Integrity
 The intern will be expected to support the procedures used to generate samples for ongoing experiments.
 Protocol Support: Assisting with the final days of the Social Instability Stress (SIS) protocol and ensuring animals are correctly grouped.
 
 Estrous Cycle Determination: For the female mice, the intern will be trained to collect vaginal samples at the time of euthanasia and assist in analyzing the cell types under a microscope to determine the phase of the estrous cycle (proestrus, estrus, metestrus, diestrus).
 
 2. Brain Tissue Processing and Immunofluorescence 
 The intern will be trained to perform the complete immunofluorescence protocol.
 
 Brain Slicing: Assisting with, or learning to, section the frozen mouse brains into 35 μm coronal slices using a cryostat. This involves correctly identifying the target regions (mPFC, amygdala, hippocampus) during slicing.
 
 Staining Protocol: Performing the multi-step staining process, which includes:
 -Washing the tissue slices in PBS.
 -Incubating slices in a blocking solution (containing goat serum and Triton X-100) to prevent non-specific antibody binding.
 -Performing the 24-hour incubation with primary antibodies, specifically Anti-ΔFosB (EPR15905) and Anti-5HT2A (ASR-033-GP200UL).
 -Washing and incubating the slices with the fluorescent secondary antibodies (Alexa Fluor 488 and Alexa-Fluor 568).
 
 Mounting: Carefully mounting the delicate, stained brain slices onto silanized glass slides and applying the Fluoroshield Mounting Medium + DAPI to stain cell nuclei and preserve the fluorescent signal.
 
 3. Microscopy and Data Analysis
 This is the core activity, identifying the pattern of activation.
 
 Image Capture: Assisting in the capture of high-resolution fluorescent images from the prepared slides using the Axio Imager 2 microscope.
 
 Data Quantification: The intern will be trained to use the ImageJ software to quantify the results. This is a critical task and involves:
 
 - Defining the regions of interest (mPFC, amygdala, hippocampus) in the digital images.
 - Applying the "Corrected total cell fluorescence" (CTCF) technique to measure the intensity of the ΔFosB and 5HT2A signals.
 - Organizing the resulting numerical data for statistical analysis.
requiredknowledgeandexperiences:
Previous experience in handling rodents (mice) in a laboratory setting.

description:
The candidate will study and develop mathematical models in epidemiology, focusing on the fundamental concepts of infectious disease transmission and prevalence within host populations.
 
 The work will begin with the basic Susceptible–Infected–Recovered (SIR) model and then progress to more complex frameworks, including vector-borne transmission and multi-host or multi-pathogen systems.
 
 The student will learn how to determine the equilibrium points of these dynamical systems and analyze their stability. Additionally, the basic reproduction number (R0) of each disease model will be derived and interpreted.
 
 Finally, the student will verify and validate the analytical results through numerical simulations, ensuring consistency between theoretical and computational findings.
 
 Skills that will be developed: Mathematical Model Analysis, Julia Language (coding), Data Analysis.
requiredknowledgeandexperiences: Basic Calculus and Programming

description:
FHNW is one of Switzerland’s leading universities of applied sciences and arts - known for its innovative, practice-oriented approach to teaching, research, and development.
 
 The FHNW School of Engineering and Environment supports companies and institutions in their innovation projects. Every year, around 250 new research and development projects are launched with business partners. More than 300 employees in 12 institutes generate knowledge and solutions that are made accessible for industries and markets. Our successful technology and IT research is also characterized by cooperation with national and international research partners.
 
 The Institutes of Polymer Nanotechnology (INKA) and Polymer Engineering (IKT) conduct industry-focused applied R&D projects in the areas of polymer synthesis, surface structuring on the micro- and nanoscale, chemical (surface) functionalization, coatings, plasma treatments and plasma coatings, and bulk modification through additives and fillers. 
 
 The topic of traineeship will deal with the preparation and investigation of polymeric materials, processes for polymer replication on the micro- and nanoscale, chemical surface modification, plasma surface modification or the synthesis of special momomers and polymers. In this context, you will apply different experimental methods for sample preparation as well as a variety of analytical techniques for characterization.
 
 Salary varies depending on study progress: Bachelor students earn 2100 CHF, Bachelor graduates 2300 CHF and Master graduates 2500 CHF

description:
The Research Group in Innovation and Development of Specialty Coffee, aims to conduct research across two lines: the transformation of specialty coffees and the governance and sustainability of the coffee ecosystem. We are seeking students in Chemical Engineering, Food Engineering, Biotechnology, Agricultural Engineering, and Agro-Industrial Engineering, who are interested in understanding how post-harvest processes affect coffee quality. Specialty Coffee refers to coffee that is graded 80 points or higher, on a 100 point scale, which has been certified by a licensed Specialty Coffee Association (SCA) Q Grader (CQI). At the RoastLab, Univalle https://sigelab.net/laboratorio/ElKStj7fl51OmQ6bvi5o , physical and chemical tests are conducted on Arabica coffee beans grown in the Colombian Coffee Cultural Landscape area. The purpose is to identify the potential for specialty coffee that can be valued by coffee consumers worldwide. These results are then transferred to producers to help standardize the processes that enable them to obtain better coffee and become more competitive in global markets.
 The student will develop the following tasks: Physical characterization of green (fresh), dried, and roasted coffee beans. Chemical characterization of green, dried, and roasted coffee beans. Experimentation in the lab and on the farm (in the field, at the productive unit, to obtain a specialty coffee). Participation in the results transfer processes with producers and the academic community. Support in the analysis of relocation agendas and the production agenda for the region (Valle del Cauca) with sustainable development criteria. ​​Participation in academic meetings, seminars, and research debates.
additional_Info: Americas and Europe students don´t need to issue a visa if their stay is shorter than 180 days.

employer: Faculty of Information Security and Digital Forensics
description:
Machine Learning, Robotic Process Automation & Computer Network Security Project
 
 Overview:
 This multidisciplinary project integrated Machine Learning (ML), Robotic Process Automation (RPA), and Computer Network Security to design, develop, and evaluate intelligent, secure, and efficient digital solutions. The ML segment focused on predictive modeling using supervised, unsupervised, and reinforcement learning with algorithms such as Decision Trees, Random Forests, and Neural Networks. RPA leveraged tools like UiPath and Automation Anywhere to automate repetitive tasks with cognitive features enabled by ML models. The security component implemented firewalls, intrusion detection systems, encryption, and vulnerability assessments to mitigate threats like malware, denial-of-service, and ransomware. Industry-standard tools, including Python, TensorFlow, and Kali Linux, were used extensively.
 
 Objectives:
 1) Develop predictive ML models with robust evaluation.
 2) Design automated RPA workflows integrated with ML.
 3) Implement and test network security protocols.
 
 Outcomes:
 1) Improved operational efficiency and reduced manual effort.
 2) Enhanced decision-making through ML-powered insights.
 3) Strengthened systems against cyberattacks.
 
 Intern’s Responsibilities:
 1) Build, train, and evaluate ML models.
 2) Create, test, and optimize RPA workflows.
 3) Configure security tools, conduct VAPT, and document findings.
other_requirements: The intern should have basic understanding of machine learning, robotic process automation, and computer network security.
additional_Info: This offer is from the Department of Digital Sciences, and the intern's field of research would be Machine Learning, Robotic Process Automation, and Computer Network Security.
requiredknowledgeandexperiences: Python, Network security, Robotics

description:
Physics-Informed Deep Learning for Battery Health and Lifetime Prediction
 
 Overview:
 This project focuses on developing a physics-informed deep learning framework to predict the Remaining Useful Life (RUL) and State-of-Health (SOH) of lithium-ion batteries in electric vehicles. By combining data-driven sequence models with embedded electrochemical constraints, the framework aims to deliver accurate, robust, and interpretable predictions under real-world conditions such as variable driving patterns, ambient temperatures, and fast-charging events.
 
 Objectives:
 1) Curate and preprocess multi-source time-series battery data.
 2) Explore feature engineering methods such as incremental capacity analysis.
 3) Implement and compare LSTM/GRU, transformer-based, and physics-informed architectures.
 4) Design loss functions that balance prediction accuracy with physical plausibility.
 
 Outcomes:
 1) A reproducible deep learning framework for RUL and SOH prediction.
 2) Benchmarked performance across multiple modeling approaches.
 3) Insights into hybrid physics-informed architectures for battery health.
 
 Responsibilities:
 1) Build and preprocess datasets for modeling and training.
 2) Implement deep learning models in PyTorch/TensorFlow.
 3) Evaluate performance under diverse driving and charging scenarios.
 4) Document findings in reports, notebooks, and presentation materials.
other_requirements: The intern should have knowledge related to supervised learning, RNNs/CNNs, and basics of transformer architectures. Familiarity with Python (PyTorch/TensorFlow), time-series data processing, and fundamental battery concepts (SOC, SOH, charge/discharge cycles) is preferred.
additional_Info:
1. The option to work from home is available for this offer. In this case, the available dates for the internship are from May 2026 - September 2026 and there will be no stipend provided.

description:
Project Title: Machine Learning Approaches for Accurate Land Use and Land Cover Classification from Remote Sensing Data.
 
 Land Use and Land Cover (LULC) mapping plays a vital role in urban planning, agriculture monitoring, deforestation studies, and climate change research. Traditionally, LULC classification relies on manual interpretation or conventional statistical techniques, which are often time-consuming and less accurate in handling large-scale remote sensing datasets.
 Machine Learning (ML) provides efficient and automated approaches to analyze satellite images (e.g., Sentinel-2, Landsat-8) for precise classification of land categories such as agriculture, water bodies, forests, and built-up areas. This project aims to apply ML techniques to classify LULC from remote sensing imagery, evaluate their accuracy, and recommend the best-performing models." "Preprocessed satellite dataset for ROI.
 
 Trained ML models for LULC classification.
 LULC thematic maps showing classified categories.
 Accuracy analysis report comparing multiple ML models.
 Workflow documentation for scalable LULC monitoring projects.
 
 This project proposes the use of machine learning for efficient LULC classification, enabling accurate and scalable mapping of land categories from satellite data. The workflow developed can support applications in agriculture, urban planning, and environmental monitoring. The project is achievable within a 6–8 week internship and will provide hands-on exposure to both remote sensing and machine learning techniques.

description:

 Title of the Project: Medical Data Analysis
 
 This project focuses on modeling sequential clinical events to analyze the progression of patient data, including lab tests, medications, and interventions. By examining temporal relationships between events, it aims to uncover hidden pathways of disease evolution, such as progression from mild infection to sepsis and organ failure.
 
 Hands-on work involves implementing techniques like recurrent neural networks, temporal point processes, and transformer-based models to capture complex dependencies in clinical data. These models provide predictive insights that enable timely interventions, personalized treatment strategies, and improved understanding of disease mechanisms in critical care.
 
 The project integrates computational modeling with clinical research, offering practical experience in data analysis, machine learning, and healthcare applications.
 
 Expected Outcomes:

 Presentation of results highlighting the impact of predictive analytics on patient care.

description:
Materials Science Intern
 Project Title: Development of Polymeric and Metallic Composite-Based Electrodeposited Coating and Its Characterization
 
 Project Overview:
 This project focuses on developing polymer-reinforced metallic coatings using electrodeposition and electrophoretic deposition techniques to prevent corrosion, which occurs when metals react with oxygen and water, forming oxides that degrade structural integrity. Such degradation can lead to structural failure and economic losses. The coatings will be designed for applications in aeronautical, automotive, marine, electrical, and mechanical industries, providing durable and protective surfaces. The project will evaluate coating performance using methods like electrochemical impedance spectroscopy, potentiodynamic polarization, hardness testing, tribology analysis, adhesion studies, and surface imaging. By combining metallic and polymeric components, the study aims to enhance corrosion resistance, mechanical strength, and surface durability, contributing to the development of long-lasting and cost-effective protective coatings for industrial applications.
 
 Expected Outcome:
 • Fabrication of polymer-metal composite coatings through electrodeposition and EPD.
 • Performance evaluation using electrochemical and mechanical tests.
 • Analytical report detailing coating characteristics and effectiveness.
 • Presentation summarizing results, surface analyses, and industrial applicability.
other_requirements: Chemistry Lab knowledge
requiredknowledgeandexperiences: Handling Electrochemical Instrument, Polymer Synthesis, Good experimental hand, Teamwork.

 as we craft user-inspired solutions. We currently handle millions of operations daily for more than 100 markets.
 We apply our pioneering concept of intelligence amplified to create our IT solutions. Our developers are empowered and their skills are enhanced by using tools such as machine learning, language models and artificial intelligence techniques. Our innovative, profoundly intuitive work is the outcome of uniting state-of-the-art technology with immense human expertise and insight.
 As a developer of custom-designed software, we offer our clients a one-stop shop service rooted in our wide technology stack, outstanding user experience and impeccable standards of quality, attested to by the certificates we hold. Internship experience: Web designer (Java, JavaScript, React, Angular, HTML, .Net), QA and testing. 
 The training can be longer depending on the student's skills and motivation.

The Machine Learning-Driven Design of Deep Eutectic Solvents (DESs) for CO2 capture relies heavily on computational screening to find sustainable, high-performance solvents. COSMO-RS (Conductor-like Screening Model for Real Solvents) and Density Functional Theory (DFT) are the core predictive tools. DFT models are used to analyze the molecular structure and electronic properties of DES components. This data is then fed into COSMO-RS to accurately forecast thermodynamic properties crucial for CO2 capture. This integrated approach enables the research to refine solvent choices and ensure their thermodynamic and kinetic suitability for high-efficiency, low-energy CO2 removal, thereby avoiding the costly experimental synthesis and large-scale testing required for traditional methods.

 2- The beneficiary (student) shall bear any bank fees or currency exchange differences that may deducted when transferring the amount.
 3- The account to which the transfer is made must be in the name of the trainee (student), and the transfer can’t be made to any other account.

description:
The candidate will work with semiconductor particle detectors for tracking and timing applications in the ATLAS experiment at CERN. The tasks will include laboratory measurements and analysis of collected data.
 
 The candidate will perform electrical tests of the samples and study charge collection with a laser setup. Data analysis will mostly be carried out with C++ (CERN ROOT framework), and using basic Python and Git tools will also be included.
 
 The work will be done at the Experimental Particle Physics department at JSI.

description:
- There are international students of nearly 20 different nationalities at ISTNU, which creates an international exchange environment here. 
 - Introduction about ISTNU: https://en.is.tnu.edu.vn/about-us/
 - Students will be assigned with Several tasks (not all tasks) in the list below: 
 - Doing experiments in a lab (depending on the projects)
 - Participating in writing a research paper for scientific journals.
 - Interns are given relevant data and figures & supervised to analyse the data, and write the different parts of the paper.
 - The goal of the project is to finally publish these results in a scientific journal. 
 - Two of several previous research with the participation of IAESTE interns:
 * Degradation of organic pollutans by mercaprosulfate using cobalt particles as a catalyst
 * Hollow cobalt oxide nanoparticles used for catalysis in hydrogen gas production
 - Student will be able to develop presentation, and scientific/ academic writing skills.
 - Working as a Teaching Assistant in Specialized subjects for the Lecturers in one, two or three of these subjects, depending on students' interest and knowledge, including: Enviromental analysis/ General and Environment Chemistry/ Statistics and Applied Statistics in Biology Science/ Organic Chemistry/ /General Microbiology/ /Conservation Biology/ General Ecology/ Biology/ Environmental Science/ Urban Ecology/ Population and Community Ecology/ Biodiversity Measurement and Estimation/ Trees and Forests/ Project Management/ Global Environmental Interactions/ Earth science and Climate Change/ Strategic Planning and Environmental Management/ /Principles of Soil Science and Soil Polution Management
 - Attending and organizing seminars related to the field of study
 - Attending English club
 - Helping students in improving their English
other_requirements: Willing to take part in extra-curricular activities
additional_Info:
- The school closes from 01 June until 30 Aug, so they cannot welcome an intern at this time. But if the student is still interested in an internship in Vietnam, you can nominate her/ his application so that we can find other employers that can welcome her/ him.
 - You can be provided a good free room which costs 3,500,000 VND/ month at the Guest - House for international teachers of the school if there are available rooms, and the school doesn't charge you for this fee. In case there are no rooms left at the Guest House during your internships, you will be provided free accommodation at the dormitory for students. Normally, all IAESTE interns at ISTNU stay at the Guest House.
requiredknowledgeandexperiences:
- Having laptop, Hard-working, Creative, Friendly, Active, Enthusiastic, Responsible, Proactive
 - Loves research work
 - Priority is given to students having working experience in: (not compulsory)
 + Chemical and environmental laboratories
 + Performing analyzes of typical water quality indicators such as ammonium, nitrate, nitrite, phosphate, heavy metals, BOD, COD
